org.pepstock.charba.client.items

Class JsItemsHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.items.JsItemsHelper

  • final class JsItemsHelper
extends Object
    This is a singleton wrapper for Java native object which is wrapping a CHARBA java script object implementation with some utilities to act on java script objects for CHARBA items.
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static JsItemsHelper INSTANCE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private JsItemsHelper()
      To avoid any instantiation

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) static JsItemsHelper get()
      Singleton object to get the helper instance
      (package private) double getBasePixel(ScaleItem scale)
      Returns the pixel for the minimum chart value.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) double getBaseValue(ScaleItem scale)
      Returns the minimum chart value.
      (package private) NativeObject getDatasetControllerStyle(NativeObject controller, int dataIndex)
      Returns a set of predefined style properties that should be used to represent the dataset or the data if the index is specified.
      (package private) double getDecimalForPixel(ScaleItem scale, double pixel)
      Used to get the data value from a given pixel.
      This is the inverse of getPixelForValue.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) String getLabelForValue(ScaleItem scale, double value)
      Used to get the label to display in the tooltip for the given value.
      (package private) double getPixelForDecimal(ScaleItem scale, double decimal)
      Utility for getting the pixel location of a percentage of scale.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) double getPixelForStringValue(ScaleItem scale, String value, double index)
      Returns the location of the given data point as string.
      (package private) double getPixelForTick(ScaleItem scale, double index)
      Returns the location of the tick at the given index.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) double getPixelForValue(ScaleItem scale, double value, double index)
      Returns the location of the given data point.
      Value can either be an index or a numerical value.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) double getValueForPixel(ScaleItem scale, double pixel)
      Used to get the data value from a given pixel.
      This is the inverse of getPixelForValue.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) boolean isCanvasGradient(NativeObject object, Key key)
      Returns true if the property in the native object is a CanvasGradientItem.
      (package private) boolean isCanvasPattern(NativeObject object, Key key)
      Returns true if the property in the native object is a CanvasPatternItem.

                        Key key)
        Returns true if the property in the native object is a CanvasPatternItem.
        Parameters:
        object - the legend or tooltip item native object on which to check the property.
        key - the string name of the property to be defined or modified..
        Returns:
        true if the property in the native object is a CanvasPatternItem

        Returns:

      • getDecimalForPixel

        double getDecimalForPixel(ScaleItem scale,
                          double pixel)
        Used to get the data value from a given pixel.
        This is the inverse of getPixelForValue.
        The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        scale - scale native object instance
        pixel - pixel value
        Returns:
        the data value from a given pixel

      • getPixelForDecimal

        double getPixelForDecimal(ScaleItem scale,
                          double decimal)
        Utility for getting the pixel location of a percentage of scale.
        The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        scale - scale native object instance
        decimal - number value to use
        Returns:
        the pixel location of a percentage of scale

      • getPixelForTick

        double getPixelForTick(ScaleItem scale,
                       double index)
        Returns the location of the tick at the given index.
        The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        scale - scale native object instance
        index - tick index to use
        Returns:
        the location of the tick at the given index

        value - value of the data
        Returns:

      • getPixelForStringValue

        double getPixelForStringValue(ScaleItem scale,
                              String value,
                              double index)
        Returns the location of the given data point as string.
        Parameters:
        scale - scale native object instance
        value - value of the data as string
        index - index of the data
        Returns:
        the location of the given data point

      • getPixelForValue

        double getPixelForValue(ScaleItem scale,
                        double value,
                        double index)
        Returns the location of the given data point.
        Value can either be an index or a numerical value.
        The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        scale - scale native object instance
        value - value of the data
        index - index of the data
        Returns:
        the location of the given data point

      • getValueForPixel

        double getValueForPixel(ScaleItem scale,
                        double pixel)
        Used to get the data value from a given pixel.
        This is the inverse of getPixelForValue.
        The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        scale - scale native object instance
        pixel - pixel value
        Returns:
        the data value from a given pixel

                                       int dataIndex)

        dataIndex - index of data
